title: NHL roundup: Islanders lose preseason finale - Hockey
text:
Buy this photo associated press T.J. Oshie of the Capitals, who later scored a goal, crashing into Islanders goalie Thomas Greiss during second period. Josh Bailey and Kyle Okposo scored for the Islanders in their 6-2 loss to Alex Ovechkin and the Capitals on Sunday in the NHL’s preseason finale in Washington.
Ovechkin scored twice and T.J. Oshie, Jay Beagle and Evgeny Kuznetsov scored in a 7:10 span of the first period for Washington, which also got a goal and three assists from John Carlson. Kuznetsov added three assists and Oshie had two.
Braden Holtby made 22 saves for Washington. 
Thomas Greiss allowed five goals on 18 shots in two periods for the Islanders. Stephon Williams gave up a goal on eight shots in the third. 
The Islanders will open their first season in Brooklyn on Friday night at home against Chicago. The Capitals will start the season at home Saturday night against the Devils.
TORRES HEARING: Sharks forward Raffi Torres will have a hearing today with the NHL Department of Player Safety for a hit on Ducks forward Jakob Silfverberg during a preseason game Saturday.
Silfverberg was hit by Torres at 12:45 of the second period. He left the game and did not return.
DATSYUK OUT: The Red Wings placed forward Pavel Datsyuk on injured reserve. Datsyuk had ankle surgery June 26 and is projected to return in early November.
He had 26 goals and 65 points in 63 games last season.
BRUINS INK GOALIE: The Bruins signed goalie Jonas Gustavsson to a one-year, $700,000 deal.
The former Red Wings and Maple Leafss goalie is expected to back up Tuukka Rask.
Gustavsson, 30, has appeared in 148 NHL games, posting a 60-55-21 record with a 2.89 goals against average and .901 save percentage. He represented Sweden in the 2014 Olympics and won a silver medal.
BRIEFS: A team spokesman said Canadiens forward Zack Kassian was treated for minor injuries in the hospital after being involved in a car accident. Montreal also signed forward Tomas Fleischmann to a one-year contract reportedly worth $750,000.
The Coyotes assigned center Dylan Strome to Erie of the OHL after their first-round pick from this year’s draft made a strong push for a roster spot. … The Flames acquired center Freddie Hamilton from the Avalanche for a conditional seventh-round pick next year.
